headline.print_headline: US to Start Training Libyan Soldiers at Midyear
headline.main: US to Start Training Libyan Soldiers at Midyear

lead_paragraph: The top U.S. military commander for Africa says the Pentagon is planning to begin training 5,000 to 8,000 Libyan soldiers by midyear to help bolster the nation's security. The U.S. is also looking into providing additional airlift assistance to South Sudan, where violence has killed more than 1,000 people and driven 180,000 from their homes in the last month.
